name: Australian Stitch
overview: Australian Stitch is a Melbourne-based clothing manufacturer specialising in ethical, locally made basics. The company focuses on fair working conditions, quality craftsmanship, and local production to counter the impacts of mass-produced fast fashion.
practices: Claims to be ethically made, ensuring proper payment, fair contact hours, equal opportunities, anti-discrimination, workers' compensation, and workplace health & safety.
Supports local and ethical manufacturing across Melbourne.
Produces clothing that is not mass produced overseas and is designed to last beyond a few washes.
Aims to offer best-fitting, reasonably priced garments made responsibly in Australia.
sdgs: SDG 8 – Decent Work and Economic Growth

diversity.inclusion_policy: Focus on anti-discrimination and fair pay

corporate_governance.description: Privately owned small business with a focus on transparent and ethical manufacturing. Governance policies are not formally disclosed.

concerns: Would benefit from publishing a sustainability or transparency report, though this is typically expected of larger corporations.
